page.title: 11HATTON GRANGE FARM KEMBERTON
page.content: The following machinery is used:- 7 tractors, 1 combine harvester 1 potato harvester, 1 sugar beet harvester. There are buildings for storing corn and hay, a barn for mixing cattle food a building for housing cattle, a milking parlour, 3 silage clamps, a chitting barn for potatoes, 2 poultry houses and 2 old coach houses where the tractors are serviced. Chemicals, cattle feed and machinery are all obtained locally, and corn and potatoes are sold to local wholesalers Craftsmen work 40 hours a week and are paid Â£103.16p. They also have a rent free cottage. The field names and crops for Grange Farm are:Ferney + Furlong = spring barley, Blue House + Twy Brook = grass Century cottages + North Mount = sugarbeet, Buildings = potatoes.
